commit_message:
Add proxy support to Vagrantfile

The creation of Development environments behind a corporate network
can result in the addition of proxy setup. This change pretends to
simplify that setup.

Change-Id: I6e698ba7a10789145ffc6a9b6325464ea76895e3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/66/703666/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ENV['http_proxy'] != nil and ENV['https_proxy'] != nil if not Vagrant.has_plugin?('vagrant-proxyconf') system 'vagrant plugin install vagrant-proxyconf' raise 'vagrant-proxyconf was installed but it requires to execute again' end config.proxy.http = ENV['http_proxy'] || ENV['HTTP_PROXY'] || "" config.proxy.https = ENV['https_proxy'] || ENV['HTTPS_PROXY'] || "" config.proxy.no_proxy = ENV['NO_PROXY'] || ENV['no_proxy'] || "127.0.0.1,localhost" end

subject: Don't create an OVSDB connection per API request
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-06-05 14:13:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ovn-octavia-provider/commit/fe44b97875d94139376b0ab3b97bf16c59026128', 'message': "Don't create an OVSDB connection per API request

Using the default ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl.Backend behavior which
stores the ovsdb_connection on the Backend class itself ensures
that when Octavia does the imports necessary for instantiating the
driver, that the ovsdb_connection will remain on the class even
though the instances are deleted. This will allow us to reuse the
OVSDB connection between APIs despite octavia-api knowing nothing
about it.

In addition, __del__() can called from any thread by the garbage
collector, and so it was possible that thread.join() would be
called by the thread we were in, throwing an Exception and
preventing cleanup.

Co-authored-by: Gregory Thiemonge <gthiemon@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Don't create an OVSDB connection per API request

Using the default ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl.Backend behavior which
stores the ovsdb_connection on the Backend class itself ensures
that when Octavia does the imports necessary for instantiating the
driver, that the ovsdb_connection will remain on the class even
though the instances are deleted. This will allow us to reuse the
OVSDB connection between APIs despite octavia-api knowing nothing
about it.

In addition, __del__() can called from any thread by the garbage
collector, and so it was possible that thread.join() would be
called by the thread we were in, throwing an Exception and
preventing cleanup.

Co-authored-by: Gregory Thiemonge <gthiemon@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Jakub Libosvar <jlibosva@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #2065460
Closes-Bug: #2065459

Conflicts:
      ovn_octavia_provider/tests/functional/test_agent.py

Change-Id: I4f5df34ab32e8b33ff54f311b9b2ac00c9be1e05
(cherry picked from commit 9c2274e813fe167b79b1ceb7f8da188e251cc6ef)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovn-octavia-provider refs/changes/84/921384/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Don't create an OVSDB connection per API request

Using the default ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl.Backend behavior which
stores the ovsdb_connection on the Backend class itself ensures
that when Octavia does the imports necessary for instantiating the
driver, that the ovsdb_connection will remain on the class even
though the instances are deleted. This will allow us to reuse the
OVSDB connection between APIs despite octavia-api knowing nothing
about it.

In addition, __del__() can called from any thread by the garbage
collector, and so it was possible that thread.join() would be
called by the thread we were in, throwing an Exception and
preventing cleanup.

Co-authored-by: Gregory Thiemonge <gthiemon@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>

Fix: Update Skyline stop task

Update Sykline stop task to use the
service-stop role to symplify the task
and make sure it is using kolla_container.

Authored-By: Roman Krček <roman.krcek@tietoevry.com>
Change-Id: I7b11359cee931273a058364160b64fe1fb606b5e

commit_message:
Fix horizon distro installation for EL

RDO is installing Horizon not under site-packages, but under /usr/share
which makes it completely different logic, with default horizon-manage
not working, as it can not import openstack_dashboard now, as

Change-Id: I4c06b4b5a206b087a9fce856f5fec936e058e3f8

commit_message:
Catch MessagingTimeout during evacuation

Accidental service interruptions in the message queue
or nova-scheduler may result a MessagingTimeout
being raised during the evacuation process.

The uncaught exception was only output in the logs,
while on the user side, they were always believed that
the evacuation action is still in progress.

Related-Bug: 2044494
Change-Id: I531c3727f3647fa2b21d749d5a80ba9914d6451d

added_lines: # Copyright 2024 EasyStack, Inc. # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from typing import Dict, List from nova.conductor import manager as conductor_manager from nova import context from nova.context import RequestContext from nova.objects.flavor import Flavor from nova.service import Service from nova import test from nova.tests import fixtures as nova_fixtures from nova.tests.fixtures.nova import OSAPIFixture from nova.tests.functional.api.client import TestOpenStackClient from nova.tests.functional import fixtures as func_fixtures from nova.tests.functional import integrated_helpers from oslo_messaging import MessagingTimeout from unittest import mock IMAGE_ID = nova_fixtures.GlanceFixture.auto_disk_config_enabled_image["id"] FLAVOR_FIXTURE = { "flavorid": "fake_flavor", "name": "fake_flavor", "vcpus": 1, "memory_mb": 512, } SERVER_FIXTURE = { "name": "fake-server-name", "image_uuid": IMAGE_ID, "flavor_id": FLAVOR_FIXTURE["flavorid"], } class TestInstanceEvacuateWithRPCTimeoutFailure( test.TestCase, integrated_helpers.InstanceHelperMixin ): context: RequestContext api: TestOpenStackClient conductor_service: Service scheduler_service: Service compute_services: Dict[str, Service] def setUp(self): super().setUp() self.context = context.get_admin_context() self.conductor = conductor_manager.ComputeTaskManager() self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.CinderFixture(self)) self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.NeutronFixture(self)) self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.GlanceFixture(self)) self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.CGroupsFixture()) self.useFixture(func_fixtures.PlacementFixture()) api_fixture = self.useFixture( nova_fixtures.OSAPIFixture(api_version="v2.1")) assert isinstance(api_fixture, OSAPIFixture) self.api = api_fixture.admin_api self.api.microversion = "2.14" # type: ignore self._start_services() Flavor(context=self.context, **FLAVOR_FIXTURE).create() def _start_services(self, compute_service_num: int = 2): """Start the compute, conductor and scheduler services. And store compute services in the compute_services dictionary. :param compute_service_num: The number of compute services to start. By default, 2 compute services will be started. """ self.compute_services = {} # Start compute services for i in range(compute_service_num): _compute_service_name = f"compute_{i}" _compute_service = self.start_service( "compute", _compute_service_name) self.compute_services.setdefault( _compute_service_name, _compute_service) # Start conductor and scheduler services self.conductor_service: Service = self.start_service( "conductor", "conductor" ) self.scheduler_service: Service = self.start_service( "scheduler", "scheduler" ) def _stop_compute_service( self, service_name: List[str] | str | None = None): """Stop the compute service(s) and force down the service(s) :param service_name: The name of the compute service(s) to stop. If None, all compute services will be stopped. """ def _stop_compute_service(service_name: str, compute_service: Service): """Stop the compute service and force down the service :param service_name: The name of the compute service to stop. :param compute_service: The compute service to stop. """ compute_service.stop() self.api.force_down_service(service_name, "nova-compute", True) self._wait_for_service_parameter( service_name, "nova-compute", {"state": "down"}) if isinstance(service_name, str): service_waiting_for_stop = self.compute_services.get(service_name) assert service_waiting_for_stop is not None _stop_compute_service(service_name, service_waiting_for_stop) self.api.force_down_service(service_name, "nova-compute", True) elif isinstance(service_name, list): for service_name in service_name: service_waiting_for_stop = self.compute_services.get( service_name) assert service_waiting_for_stop is not None _stop_compute_service(service_name, service_waiting_for_stop) # Stop all compute services else: for service_name, compute_service in self.compute_services.items(): _stop_compute_service(service_name, compute_service) def _create_instance(self): server = self._create_server(**SERVER_FIXTURE) return self._wait_for_state_change(server, "ACTIVE") def test_evacuate_instance_with_messaging_timeout(self): # Create an instance instance = self._create_instance() # Get the instance host instance_host = instance.get("OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host") assert isinstance(instance_host, str) # self.api.post_server_action(instance["id"], {"os-stop": None}) # self._wait_for_state_change(instance, "SHUTOFF") self._stop_compute_service(instance_host) with mock.patch.object( self.conductor_service.manager.compute_task_mgr, "_schedule_instances", side_effect=MessagingTimeout ): expected_params = { # actually, the state is "REBUILD" "expected_state": "ERROR", # actually, the task state is "rebuilding" "expected_task_state": None, # actually, the migration status is "accepted" "expected_migration_status": "error" } self._evacuate_server( instance, **expected_params)

commit_message:
baremetal: Decode 'config_drive' argument to 'set_provision_state'

ironicclient automatically decoded the base64-encoded byte strings
provided to the 'node.set_provision_state' method. We should do the
same.

Change-Id: Ib4997d11b460078cddf2f422223a67a216cf17df
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove py38-fips jobs because stream8 is dead

The centos project has yanked their entire mirror of stream8:

https://mirror.dfw.rax.opendev.org/centos/8-stream/readme

As such, these jobs can't run at all and thus will block any patches
from landing.

Change-Id: I7b86f9036914dec59db01347ac8a2163e6e9843f
(cherry picked from commit 56da508eaf9dc23deb4a9adcc564162943f1954b)

commit_message:
Fix missing oslo.log options in migration tool

The migration tool does not register the oslo.log options so fails to
set up its logger. Ensure that the options are loaded before
setup_logging call to fix it.

Closes-Bug: #2067557
Change-Id: I902f49f4efa0da80021c2eda4b7fcb63cc1310b0

commit_message:
Use zoneinfo instead of pytz if available

The zoneinfo module was introduced in Python 3.9. We can use that
built-in module instead of the 3rd party library (pytz).

This is based on change I1f88bdadc68bfa726eac1da1c5824c1ed352ad98 in
oslo.utils.

Change-Id: If6aeb6c837d413c9d9a544a80c4c736efc8455fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/45/906945/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: import zoneinfo except ImportError: # zoneinfo is available in Python >= 3.9 import pytz zoneinfo = None now_utc = timeutils.utcnow().replace(tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc) for tc in alarm.time_constraints: if zoneinfo: tz = (zoneinfo.ZoneInfo(tc['timezone']) if tc['timezone'] else None) else: tz = pytz.timezone(tc['timezone']) if tc['timezone'] else None
deleted_lines: import pytz now_utc = timeutils.utcnow().replace(tzinfo=pytz.utc) for tc in alarm.time_constraints: tz = pytz.timezone(tc['timezone']) if tc['timezone'] else None

commit_message:
Support l3 stateless firewall based on OVN

This patch implements a driver based on OVN, it creates port_group
for every l3 firewall_group and adds relating ports to port_group,
it also transforms firewall_rules to stateless acls.

Tests will been put in next patch.

NOTE: it depends on ML2/OVN.

Partially-Implements: blueprint support-l3-firewall-for-ovn-driver
Related-Bug: #1971958
Change-Id: If153645b3da198ef1746e98af80ac6f0a0b41bf9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/56/845756/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2022 EasyStack. All rights reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from neutron_lib import constants as const from neutron_fwaas.services.firewall.service_drivers.ovn import \ constants as ovn_const from neutron_fwaas.services.firewall.service_drivers.ovn import \ exceptions as ovn_fw_exc def acl_direction(direction, port=None, port_group=None): if direction == const.INGRESS_DIRECTION: portdir = 'outport' else: portdir = 'inport' if port: return '%s == "%s"' % (portdir, port['id']) return '%s == @%s' % (portdir, port_group) def acl_ethertype(rule): match = '' ip_version = None icmp = None if rule['ip_version'] == const.IP_VERSION_4: match = ' && ip4' ip_version = 'ip4' icmp = 'icmp4' elif rule['ip_version'] == const.IP_VERSION_6: match = ' && ip6' ip_version = 'ip6' icmp = 'icmp6' return match, ip_version, icmp def acl_ip(rule, ip_version): src_ip = rule.get('source_ip_address') dst_ip = rule.get('destination_ip_address') src = ' && %s.src == %s' % (ip_version, src_ip) if src_ip else '' dst = ' && %s.dst == %s' % (ip_version, dst_ip) if dst_ip else '' return src + dst def get_protocol_number(protocol): if protocol is None: return try: protocol = int(protocol) if 0 <= protocol <= 255: return str(protocol) except (ValueError, TypeError): protocol = ovn_const.PROTOCOL_NAME_TO_NUM_MAP.get(protocol) if protocol is not None: return protocol raise ovn_fw_exc.ProtocolNotSupported( protocol=protocol, valid_protocols=', '.join(ovn_const.PROTOCOL_NAME_TO_NUM_MAP)) def get_min_max_ports_from_range(port_range): if not port_range: return [None, None] min_port, sep, max_port = port_range.partition(":") if not max_port: max_port = min_port return [int(min_port), int(max_port)] def acl_protocol_ports(protocol, port_range, is_dst=True): match = '' min_port, max_port = get_min_max_ports_from_range(port_range) dir = 'dst' if is_dst else 'src' if protocol in ovn_const.TRANSPORT_PROTOCOLS: if min_port is not None and min_port == max_port: match += ' && %s.%s == %d' % (protocol, dir, min_port) else: if min_port is not None: match += ' && %s.%s >= %d' % (protocol, dir, min_port) if max_port is not None: match += ' && %s.%s <= %d' % (protocol, dir, max_port) return match def acl_protocol_and_ports(rule, icmp): match = '' protocol = get_protocol_number(rule.get('protocol')) if protocol is None: return match src_port = rule.get('source_port') dst_port = rule.get('destination_port') if protocol in ovn_const.TRANSPORT_PROTOCOLS: protocol = ovn_const.PROTOCOL_NUM_TO_NAME_MAP[protocol] match += ' && %s' % protocol match += acl_protocol_ports(protocol, src_port, is_dst=False) match += acl_protocol_ports(protocol, dst_port) elif protocol in ovn_const.ICMP_PROTOCOLS: protocol = icmp match += ' && %s' % protocol else: match += ' && ip.proto == %s' % protocol return match def acl_action_and_priority(action): if action == 'allow': return ovn_const.ACL_ACTION_ALLOW_STATELESS, ovn_const.ACL_PRIORITY_ALLOW elif action == 'deny': return ovn_const.ACL_ACTION_DROP, ovn_const.ACL_PRIORITY_DROP elif action == 'reject': return ovn_const.ACL_ACTION_REJECT, ovn_const.ACL_PRIORITY_REJECT def acl_entry_for_port_group(port_group, rule, direction, match): dir_map = {const.INGRESS_DIRECTION: 'to-lport', const.EGRESS_DIRECTION: 'from-lport'} action, priority = acl_action_and_priority(rule['action']) acl = {"port_group": port_group, "priority": priority, "action": action, "log": False, "name": [], "severity": [], "direction": dir_map[direction], "match": match, ovn_const.OVN_FWR_EXT_ID_KEY: rule['id']} return acl def get_rule_acl_for_port_group(port_group, rule, direction): match = acl_direction(direction, port_group=port_group) ip_match, ip_version, icmp = acl_ethertype(rule) match += ip_match match += acl_ip(rule, ip_version) match += acl_protocol_and_ports(rule, icmp) return acl_entry_for_port_group(port_group, rule, direction, match)

commit_message:
Convert destroy scripts into playbooks

Putting the tasks into playbooks makes
it easier to maintain and extend and
adds more granularity, so services
can be destroyed individually.

Some datadirs were not removed during the
destroy process. This patch fixes that.

When DockerWorker was called to remove
an image, it would fail to remove the
image if it was not bound to one of the
running containers and it wouldn't report
failure. This patch also fixes that.

Closes-bug: #1693811
Partial-Bug: #1582158
Change-Id: Icfd597224fa2e33a0f98781d2dcc313ba0436e62
Signed-off-by: Roman Krček <roman.krcek@tietoevry.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/14/920714/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #!/usr/bin/env bash # Spawning the neutron agents containers leaves artifacts on the host. # This script removes these artifacts. ip netns list | while read -r line ; do echo "Removing network namespace $line on the host" ip netns delete $line done ip -o link show | awk -F': ' '/tap/{print $2}' | while read -r ifname ; do echo "Removing tap interface $ifname on the host" ip link delete $ifname type veth done ip -o link show | awk -F': ' '/brq/{print $2}' | while read -r ifname ; do echo "Removing linux bridge $ifname on the host" ip link delete $ifname type bridge done ip -o link show | awk -F': ' '/vxlan/{print $2}' | while read -r ifname ; do echo "Removing vxlan interface $ifname on the host" ip link delete $ifname type vxlan done # Keepalived leaves VIP on the host in case of accidental removal. # This snippet removes VIPs. if [[ "$enable_haproxy" == "yes" ]]; then ip -o addr list | awk '{print $2,$4}' | cut -d/ -f1 | while read -r ifname ifaddr ; do if [[ "$kolla_internal_vip_address" == "$ifaddr" || "$kolla_external_vip_address" == "$ifaddr" ]]; then echo "Removing VIP $ifaddr on the host" ip addr delete dev $ifname $ifaddr fi done fi echo "Creating a fstab backup..." sudo cp /etc/fstab /etc/fstab_backup if [[ "$enable_swift" == "yes" ]]; then echo "Removing swift references from fstab..." cat /etc/fstab | grep "/srv/node/d*" | xargs umount sed -i '/\/srv\/node\//d' /etc/fstab fi if [[ "$glance_file_datadir_volume" != "glance" && -d "$glance_file_datadir_volume" ]]; then echo "Removing glance volume if it is customized" rm -rfv $glance_file_datadir_volume fi if [[ "$nova_instance_datadir_volume" != "nova_compute" && -d "$nova_instance_datadir_volume" ]]; then echo "Removing nova_compute volume if it is customized" rm -rfv $nova_instance_datadir_volume fi if [[ "$gnocchi_metric_datadir_volume" != "gnocchi" && -d "$gnocchi_metric_datadir_volume" ]]; then echo "Removing gnocchi volume if it is customized" rm -rfv $gnocchi_metric_datadir_volume fi if [[ "$influxdb_datadir_volume" != "influxdb" && -d "$influxdb_datadir_volume" ]]; then echo "Removing influxdb volume if it is customized" rm -rfv $influxdb_datadir_volume fi if [[ "$opensearch_datadir_volume" != "opensearch" && -d "$opensearch_datadir_volume" ]]; then echo "Removing opensearch volume if it is customized" rm -rfv $opensearch_datadir_volume fi FOLDER_PATH="/etc/kolla" if [[ -e "$FOLDER_PATH/ovsdpdk-db/ovs-dpdkctl.sh" ]]; then echo uninstalling ovs-dpdk service files and tools. sudo CONFIG_FILE="$FOLDER_PATH/ovsdpdk-db/ovs-dpdkctl.conf" $FOLDER_PATH/ovsdpdk-db/ovs-dpdkctl.sh uninstall fi echo "Getting folders name..." for dir in $FOLDER_PATH/*; do if [ "$dir" == "$FOLDER_PATH/passwords.yml" ] || \ [ "$dir" == "$FOLDER_PATH/globals.yml" ] || \ [ "$dir" == "$FOLDER_PATH/globals.d" ] || \ [ "$dir" == "$FOLDER_PATH/kolla-build.conf" ] || \ [ "$dir" == "$FOLDER_PATH/config" ] || \ [ "$dir" == "$FOLDER_PATH/certificates" ]; then echo "Skipping:" $dir else rm -rfv $dir fi done if [[ "$destroy_include_dev" == "yes" ]]; then echo "Cleaning up dev repos..." rm -rfv "${kolla_dev_repos_directory}" fi

commit_message:
Fix backup delete issue when source and destination vserver are same

Added the logic in resource cleanup part to delete the vserver
peering when source and destination vserver are not same.

Closes-bug: #2058642
Change-Id: I02a70642a22095ab202f5846fff04d25321c4c1c

commit_message:
Adding osbpo repository to docker

To install docker version of 6.0.0 on Debian we need to
add osbpo repository and store docker package there. This
is needed for the patchset refactoring docker worker:
 https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/908295

Change-Id: If1ebf6a1dded1f884af2e94a714854a0523eeb67
Signed-off-by: Ivan Halomi <ivan.halomi@tietoevry.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collection-kolla refs/changes/58/916258/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: docker_sdk_osbpo_apt_url: "http://osbpo.debian.net/debian" docker_sdk_osbpo_apt_repo: "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/osbpo.asc] {{ docker_sdk_osbpo_apt_url }} bookworm-bobcat-backports-nochange main"

commit_message:
Fix exception when updating non-existing gnocchi resources

This previously raised an KeyError, as the 'id' was pop'ed inside the
try-except statement, so when the exception was catched the key has already
been removed.

Closes-bug: #2064124
Change-Id: I617d9149d1ff45cb81b71feeb3097ac1f9cd0116

commit_message:
Remove metrics specific to OpenDaylight

The following metrics are all specific to OpenDaylight but
OpenDaylight support was already removed and we no longer need to
maintain these.

 - switch.flow
 - switch.table
 - switch.port.*.drops
 - switch.port.*.errors
 - switch.port.receive.*_error
 - switch.port.collision.count

Change-Id: I2f5f71d0a1ed7de0e0886e104445b087bdc05d67

commit_message:
Remove Windows OS support

It was deprecated during the previous cycle because of retired
WinStackers project[1].

The following pollsters are also removed because these are supported
only by Hyper-V inspector.
 - disk.device.latency
 - disk.device.iops

[1] 7660339b4a4d578f2615fd6c27e8c9627ab29d37

Change-Id: I872f93b945233a1288c773302be3835db2fd2e4f

commit_message:
Add seed service destroy

This can be useful when using a seed VM that is not deployed by kayobe,
and can therefore not use ``kayobe seed deprovision``, especially when
iterating on kayobe-config during the inital stages of a deployment, or
for development, where you want to re-run the playbooks from a clean-ish
state.

Change-Id: I43a9c2a57fcfe2c9d84f39903aac7c258f9a897f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/02/911702/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: seed_service_destroy = kayobe.cli.commands:SeedServiceDestroykayobe.cli.seed_service_destroy = hooks = kayobe.cli.commands:HookDispatcher

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-04-30 16:35:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/3805486b10efe316fbd19a435437899596d8de13', 'message': 'Prevent accidental overriding of Ansible extensions

When using the custom playbook feature, it is possible to affect the
behaviour of internal kayobe playbooks by installing newer versions of
roles, collections, or plugins. This is almost always undesirable. It
occurs because ansible extensions in kayobe config currently have
precedence over the kayobe internal variants. We can prevent users
accidentally breaking kayobe internal playbooks by searching for
extensions in paths in the kayobe install first, followed by kayobe
config (but only when running internal playbooks). The behaviour when
running external playbooks is unchanged. This method still allows you to
install additional plugins, which can be useful in kayobe config e.g
processing a variable with a custom filter plugin.

commit_message:
Prevent accidental overriding of Ansible extensions

When using the custom playbook feature, it is possible to affect the
behaviour of internal kayobe playbooks by installing newer versions of
roles, collections, or plugins. This is almost always undesirable. It
occurs because ansible extensions in kayobe config currently have
precedence over the kayobe internal variants. We can prevent users
accidentally breaking kayobe internal playbooks by searching for
extensions in paths in the kayobe install first, followed by kayobe
config (but only when running internal playbooks). The behaviour when
running external playbooks is unchanged. This method still allows you to
install additional plugins, which can be useful in kayobe config e.g
processing a variable with a custom filter plugin.

Change-Id: I34f0351dbcb50104c9a4d6706d94a349c3ea3b9f
Fixes-Bug: #2056473
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/62/917762/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | The Ansible search paths, when running Kayobe internal playbooks, have been modified so that collections, roles and plugins internal to the Kayobe install have precedence over those installed in Kayobe config. This improves the usability as it now possible to install a newer version of a extension without affecting internal kayobe playbooks. upgrade: - | Ansible plugins, roles, and collections (collectiviely known as extensions) installed in Kayobe config no longer have precedence over internal kayobe variants of the same extension. You can revert back to the previous behaviour by manually exporting the relevant ansible variables, e.g ``ANSIBLE_COLLECTIONS_PATH``. It is not anticapated that this will affect many users as it is still possible to supplement kayobe with addtional plugins.

subject: enable numa live migration in the ceph job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-03-20 19:34:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/137d8b399a4fc6cc66fa3b6cdfcacfaa535ad359', 'message': 'enable numa live migration in the ceph job

The non ceph live migration job tests non numa live migration
this change makes the ceph job test live migration of instnaces with
numa topology. Specifically this change adds hw:mem_page_size=small
wich uses small pages i.e. 4k pages just like the non numa case.

As our ci vms have only one numa node the fact that hw:mem_page_size=small
request a guest with only one numa node will not break anyting
The existing jobs did not use memory over subscription so that also does not change
the only thing that does change is this will enable the numa aware
memory live migration code path.

live migration without numa or cpu_shared_set is tested in several jobs
including nova-ovs-hybrid-plug so we still have full coverage in our
existing jobs

commit_message:
enable numa live migration in the ceph job

The non ceph live migration job tests non numa live migration
this change makes the ceph job test live migration of instnaces with
numa topology. Specifically this change adds hw:mem_page_size=small
wich uses small pages i.e. 4k pages just like the non numa case.

As our ci vms have only one numa node the fact that hw:mem_page_size=small
request a guest with only one numa node will not break anyting
The existing jobs did not use memory over subscription so that also does not change
the only thing that does change is this will enable the numa aware
memory live migration code path.

live migration without numa or cpu_shared_set is tested in several jobs
including nova-ovs-hybrid-plug so we still have full coverage in our
existing jobs

Change-Id: Ia3e2df04bb531365ed8a781b680e1251038aee69

commit_message:
enable zswap in nova ci jobs.

This change enables zswap and tuned the guest file
and memory sysctl paramaters to try and mask io latency.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/890693
Change-Id: I14fe9e2f33f6a8054d988859a080572b720ac1c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/91/905791/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - zswap: &zswap_args ENABLE_SYSCTL_MEM_TUNING: true ENABLE_SYSCTL_NET_TUNING: true ENABLE_ZSWAP: true - uec_images: &uec_image_vars # We are using the split kernel/initramfs image by default in an # effort to reduce the occurrence of guest kernel panics in the APIC # timer handler. We will cover testing of the full disk image by # using it in the nova-next job. CIRROS_VERSION: 0.6.2 DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME: cirros-0.6.2-x86_64-uec DEFAULT_IMAGE_FILE_NAME: cirros-0.6.2-x86_64-uec.tar.gz # We need to set the IMAGE_URLS manually in order to get a UEC image # for what Tempest will use for CONF.compute.image_ref_alt. If we don't do this, the full disk # image will be downloaded and used for image_ref_alt instead. We will cover testing of the full disk image by # using it in the nova-next job. CIRROS_VERSION: 0.6.2 DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME: cirros-0.6.2-x86_64-uec DEFAULT_IMAGE_FILE_NAME: cirros-0.6.2-x86_64-uec.tar.gz # We need to set the IMAGE_URLS manually in order to get a UEC image # for what Tempest will use for CONF.compute.image_ref_alt. The first # image will be used for CONF.compute.image_ref and the second image # for CONF.compute.image_ref_alt. If we don't do this, the full disk # image will be downloaded and used for image_ref_alt instead. DOWNLOAD_DEFAULT_IMAGES: false IMAGE_URLS: http://download.cirros-cloud.net/0.6.2/cirros-0.6.2-x86_64-uec.tar.gz, http://download.cirros-cloud.net/0.6.1/cirros-0.6.1-x86_64-uec.tar.gz TEMPEST_COMPUTE_TYPE: compute_legacy

commit_message:
Use global upper-constraints

python-aodhclient decided *not* to use global upper constraints but
this introduced frequent problems in the past mainly because of
conflict between global upper vs local upper.

Given the fact that aodh itself is using the global constraints,
switching aodhclient to use global constraints allows much easier
maintenance now.

Change-Id: I93474bd3b8198110425e6ba0036fbb3dac1f1f84

added_lines: def driver_raid_property_list(self, fields=None, params=''): """List a driver's RAID logical disk properties. :param List fields: List of fields to show :param List params: Additional kwargs :return: list of JSON driver RAID properties objects """ opts = self.get_opts(fields=fields) output = self.openstack('baremetal driver raid property list {} {}' .format(opts, params)) return json.loads(output)

commit_message:
Improve logging at '_numa_cells_support_network_metadata'

This adds 'debug' level messages at the branches of the function that
lead to a 'False' result. These branches are:

  - Physnet found affinity on a NUMA cell outside the chosen ones
  - Tunneled networks found affinity on a NUMA cell outside the
    chosen ones

Partial-Bug: #1751784

Change-Id: I4d45f383b3c4794f8a114047455efb764f60f2a2
(cherry picked from commit 1915a3122a1df1f0dbe5edbaf25919f8875733af)
(cherry picked from commit 0d970bfa5a73ef20dcedce4336140850fd4ea363)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/41/900841/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: removed_physnets = False removed_physnets = True if required_physnets and removed_physnets: LOG.debug('Not all requested physnets have affinity to one ' 'of the chosen host NUMA cells. Remaining physnets ' 'are: %(physnets)s.', {'physnets': required_physnets}) required_physnets_outside = required_physnets.intersection( host_cell.network_metadata.physnets) if required_physnets_outside: LOG.debug('One or more requested physnets require affinity to ' 'a NUMA cell outside of the chosen host cells. This ' 'host cell cannot satisfy network requests for ' 'these physnets: %(physnets)s', {'physnets': required_physnets_outside}) LOG.debug('Tunneled networks have no affinity to any of the chosen ' 'host NUMA cells.') LOG.debug('The host declares NUMA affinity for tunneled ' 'networks. The current instance requests a ' 'tunneled network but this host cell is out of ' 'the set declared to be local to the tunnel ' 'network endpoint. As such, this host cell cannot ' 'support the requested tunneled network.')

commit_message:
Remove old excludes

These are detected as errors since the clean up was done[1] in
the requirements repository. Minimum versions are bumped to avoid
installing these known bad versions.

[1] 314734e938f107cbd5ebcc7af4d9167c11347406

Also remove the note about old pip's behavior because the resolver
in recent pip no longer requires specific order.

Change-Id: I430eaf4d113ea1051a275d2fc17db3519c85a362

commit_message:
Remove unused werkzeug requirement

The Werkzeug package was included in the designate requirements.txt, but it is
not used by designate.
This patch removes this requirement.

Change-Id: I29b1aba0e8aa455eed7977a5efe887f201963a3c
(cherry picked from commit b6cfb7f10cce72f935ba12d49bb02536abc947f5)

commit_message:
Define region and interface for collector/fetcher

It appears, that produced gnocchiclient does not respect region_name
from the auth_section, thus it needs to be defined directly for the
fetcher.

We align collector for now with fetcher, to make change backportable.

Closes-Bug: #2067084
Change-Id: If3a37b6190449e18446e65ce3b8cb70cd9038c37
(cherry picked from commit fae91db568637021438ffe436fb935a6735feb66)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cloudkitty refs/changes/54/921054/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if cloudkitty_collector == 'gnocchi' %}interface = internalURL region_name = {{ cloudkitty_service_region }} {% endif %}{% if cloudkitty_collector == 'gnocchi' %}interface = internalURL region_name = {{ cloudkitty_service_region }} {% endif %}

commit_message:
Added method for getting kvm session

This allows the caller to get a temporary username and password for a
KVM session.

Change-Id: Iab7ea57f8864995fa7c4538dd110496b7be7af72
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sushy-oem-idrac refs/changes/20/917020/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from sushy.resources import common get_kvm_session = common.ActionField('#DelliDRACCardService.GetKVMSession') def get_kvm_session(self): target_uri = self._actions.get_kvm_session.target_uri LOG.debug('Getting KVM session from iDRAC %s ...', self.identity) data = {"SessionTypeName": "ssl_cert.txt"} result = self._conn.post(target_uri, data=data) LOG.info('Got KVM session from iDRAC', result) if result.status_code in (200, 202): return result.json() return None

commit_message:
Client support port name

This patch implements port name support for the client.

Change-Id: Ida51028fbfdb52de0731ed55e4458ec67f41037b

to be created.

commit_message:
Set X-Forwarded-Proto header in apache conditionally

Ther X-Forward-Proto header must be added on the external loadbalancer only,
otherwise admin, internal endpoint requests to keystone may suddenly flip to
HTTPS while HTTP is configured in default.
This also affects request to local keystone API calls for monitoring etc.

The header is added once `keystone_service_internaluri_insecure` is enabled.

Closes-Bug: #2068039
Change-Id: I4cfef16841f95328d4ae7e4666f5a8fac053440b

commit_message:
Spec for backup backend switch

There should be a way to switch to a different backup backend on existing
cinder deployment, where data is already stored without losing the data.

The idea is to transition from old to new backup backend as transparently as
possible from end-user perspective, without the need to move data between
backends, or any action by end-user.

Once the switch is done, no new data should be written to old backend.

Partial-Implements: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/backup-backend-switch
Change-Id: I7536015287109479c473e22cc4c3da42921ec7c7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/66/921366/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ========================================== Backup backend switch ========================================== It is a viable scenario that openstack operator may want to change backup backend. There should be a way to switch to a different backup backend on existing cinder deployment, where data is already stored without losing the data. The idea is to transition from old to new backup backend as transparently as possible from end-user perspective, without the need to move data between backends, or any action by end-user. Once the switch is done, no new data should be written to old backend. Scope of this blueprint/spec may be limited to backup drivers based on ChunkedDriver. Problem description =================== Currently, if `backup_driver` is changed, all existing backups are invalid due to: 1. Driver mismatch and resulting exception presented to end-users when they access the data. 2. Cinder not being able to communicate with previous backup backend, as only one driver can be loaded at a time. Use Cases ========= Simple use cases: 1. When new full backup is created, data is stored on new backend. All related incremental backups are naturally stored on new backend. 2. Backups stored on old backend can be restored. 3. Backups stored on old backend can be deleted. 4. Backup import and export can be done regardless of the backend. 5. Backup state can be changed regardless of the backend. 6. Backup properties can be set regardless of the backend. Complex use cases: 7. Despite full backup done before the switch, incremental backup can still be done after the switch. Incremental backups should be stored on the new backend. 8. Despite full backup done before the switch and incremental backup done after the switch, volume can be restored. 9. Despite full backup done before the switch and incremental backup done after the switch, all related backups in the chain can be deleted. Actors are deployer - where the data is stored and end user - (no-) impact of the change. Simple use cases are mandatory. Complex use cases are preferable - they may be in further work scope, but must not be forgotten. Proposed change =============== **This section must be refined!** Multiple backends [2] preferably should be supported. Alternatively - to limit amount of initial work - specify backends in [DEFAULT] config section. New field `backup_type`, similar to `volume_type`, should be added. In create backup, scheduler should check if the `backup_type` is associated to a backend, then create it there; else - randomize the create between the available backup backends. Create, delete, restore, etc. features should work based on the backup type. Documentation should be added to explain how to deploy cinder to support the scenario. Alternatives ------------ Generic backup [3] might address the requirements, but it's unclear to me if it'll cover complex use cases. Also, it's a big feature that address a lot of use cases not related to the problem. There is also a very specific solution to this particular problem. A proxy driver managing two existing driver instances can be implemented. It would take decision based on "service" field (or by default select target backend) and use the right driver object to perform needed action. Limitations apply - driver interface must the the same, in this case being ChunkedDriver-based. During PTG this solution was rejected from upstream development, being suitable only for downstream needs. Data model impact ----------------- **This section must be refined!** New parameter `backup_type`. Scope of impact of this should be defined [marekc: CRUD needed to manage the `backup_type` impacting the API?] REST API impact --------------- **This section must be refined!** `backup_type` CRUD? Security impact --------------- None. Active/Active HA impact ----------------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- **This section must be refined!** Enough cinder nodes to handle both backends and keep system resiliency. `backup_type` config parameter added. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- This is only a blueprint for now. Work Items ---------- **This section must be refined!** Dependencies ============ **This section must be refined!** Command-line client and horizon update to manage backup types - connected with `backup_type` introduction. Backup Backends Configuration [2]. Testing ======= **This section must be refined!** Functional tests or tempest should cover this scenario - create backup object for old backup backend, force cinder to save data as if new backend is used. Check also restore/delete/export/import/properties. Documentation Impact ==================== Cinder Administration - the backend switch process and procedure. References ========== Topic was discussed on PTG with comments and proposals: [1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/dalmatian-ptg-cinder#L297 [2] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cinder-specs/specs/victoria/backup-backends-configuration.html [3] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cinder-specs/specs/untargeted/generic-backup-implementation.html

commit_message:
[NetApp] Pause and resume clone split during rename snapshot

When snpashot are soft deleted i.e. they are renamed if delete fails,
sometime we face issue in rename operation. This is due to busy
snapshot clone split operations. So perform rename and then start clone
split.

Closes-bug: #2025641
Change-Id: I1093a610f31f5971bb23b9f89c64f5f129ac2fb9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/37/894637/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def soft_delete_snapshot(self, volume_name, snapshot_name, vserver_client, snapshot_children=[]): for snapshot_child in snapshot_children: vserver_client.volume_clone_split_stop(snapshot_child['name']) for snapshot_child in snapshot_children: vserver_client.volume_clone_split_start(snapshot_child['name'])

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2024.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2024.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0beab3e1a3731e2cf779317d4cfd68b9e3799fd4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/58/921358/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pip install -c{env:TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/2024.1} {opts} {packages}

Change-Id: Ic11b6d23aac2cfb309f4ca23b137bb3458154935

commit_message:
pytest-based selenium tests add fix instance deleted assertion

During deleting, instance have interphases like task=deleting
or status=deleted. During the test assertion can happen that
instance is still correctly in the deleting process but the
test fail because of expectation is that instance from sdk is
None

Change-Id: Ic11b6d23aac2cfb309f4ca23b137bb3458154935
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/85/920885/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time def wait_for_instance_is_deleted(openstack, instance_name): for attempt in range(10): if openstack.compute.find_server(instance_name) is None: break else: time.sleep(3) wait_for_instance_is_deleted(openstack_demo, instance_name) wait_for_instance_is_deleted(openstack_admin, instance_name)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/2024.1

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/2024.1.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/2024.1.

Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
CI: rework RMQ steps for queue migrations

Changes the process so that queues are migrated using the previous
release kayobe config.

Migrations only need to be run in SLURP jobs.

Related-Bug: #2058512
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kayobe/+/919925
Change-Id: I86ec504729df95e0f86ad1f6c085ee8c026668c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/78/913878/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "Migrating to RabbitMQ quorum queues"
deleted_lines: echo "Migrating to RabbitMQ HA queues" kayobe overcloud service upgrade -kt rabbitmq --skip-prechecks

commit_message:
Filter flavors to hide less than minimum values

* Fetch minimum values for RAM and vCPUs from Horizon API call.
* Display filtered set of flavors when creating a cluster.
* Defaults to minimum of 2 vCPUs, 2 GiB RAM.

Change-Id: I039c35f29f53ae27fe24f2f0ab5e2cc13e57ba74

commit_message:
vmwareapi: Mark driver as experimental

Once again, the CI has disappeared for this. It doesn't appear to be a
priority for VMWare and we'd be lying to users if we suggested
otherwise. Mark the driver as experimental. We can explore deprecating
it down the line once it starts costing us.

Change-Id: I48d9812851449768797bbe799b3fe84fa2ce6d02
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 713ef7839670bd5d73af52c211a14932adc933ba)

commit_message:
[OpenStackAnsible] Cut stable/2024.1 branch for openstack-ansible

This release patch is to ensure, that trailing typed projects have been
branched for 2024.1 Caracal. The deadline for these deliverables is
June 6th, 2024.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this or update/-1
if something should be changed.

Change-Id: I5b79f21752be5a355f7c16f423ea23d9234d3880

subject: Allow polling agent to publish to tcp
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-06-05 07:22:37.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/polling/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/670fd1714e602f5f4fef1f64fb8688c3709cb2ac', 'message': 'Allow polling agent to publish to tcp

Currently, the polling agent always sends the metrics
to the RabbitMQ for the notification agent to process.
This is very cumbersome for compute nodes, as hundreds,
or potentially thousands of compute nodes can be sending
their metrics to the centralized RabbitMQ for processing.
This is an inefficient process if Gnocchi (deprecated)
is not being used as the metric storage backend.
This change allows the polling agent to send metrics
directly via a tcp socket to a local agent. This is
very efficient and can be used to connect directly
the computes to the metric storage without having
to go through the centralized RabbitMQ.

Change-Id: Ic4bdc7575b07adddb1aa2f1bf0cf4f070d892412
'}]
commit_message:
Allow polling agent to publish to tcp

Currently, the polling agent always sends the metrics
to the RabbitMQ for the notification agent to process.
This is very cumbersome for compute nodes, as hundreds,
or potentially thousands of compute nodes can be sending
their metrics to the centralized RabbitMQ for processing.
This is an inefficient process if Gnocchi (deprecated)
is not being used as the metric storage backend.
This change allows the polling agent to send metrics
directly via a tcp socket to a local agent. This is
very efficient and can be used to connect directly
the computes to the metric storage without having
to go through the centralized RabbitMQ.

Change-Id: Ic4bdc7575b07adddb1aa2f1bf0cf4f070d892412
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/53/921353/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

It only ' 'has effect if enable_tcp is True.'), if self.manager.conf.polling.enable_notifications: self.manager.notifier.sample( {}, 'telemetry.polling', {'samples': samples} ) if self.manager.conf.polling.enable_tcp: publisher = TCPPublisher(self.manager.conf, netutils.urlsplit(self.manager.conf.polling.tcp_socket)) publisher.publish_samples(self._build_samples(samples)) def _build_samples(self, samples): for sample_dict in samples: yield sample.Sample( name=sample_dict['counter_name'], type=sample_dict['counter_type'], unit=sample_dict['counter_unit'], volume=sample_dict['counter_volume'], user_id=sample_dict['user_id'], project_id=sample_dict['project_id'], resource_id=sample_dict['resource_id'], timestamp=sample_dict['timestamp'], resource_metadata=sample_dict['resource_metadata'], source=sample_dict['source'], id=sample_dict['message_id'], # Project name and username might not be set, depending on the # configuration `tenant_name_discovery`. Therefore, we cannot # assume that they exist in the sample dictionary. user_name=sample_dict.get('user_name'), project_name=sample_dict.get('project_name') ) if self.conf.polling.enable_notifications: self.notifier = oslo_messaging.Notifier( messaging.get_transport(self.conf), driver=self.conf.publisher_notifier.telemetry_driver, publisher_id="ceilometer.polling")
deleted_lines: self.manager.notifier.sample( {}, 'telemetry.polling', {'samples': samples} ) self.notifier = oslo_messaging.Notifier( messaging.get_transport(self.conf), driver=self.conf.publisher_notifier.telemetry_driver, publisher_id="ceilometer.polling")

commit_message:
Stop stack traces on Swift when receiving 403

If the credentials are not set correctly, the objectstore
poller will throw a stack trace trying to access swift
tenants where response is 403 Forbidden. We already catch
and handle gracefully the 404 in the endpoint code,
extending that to cover 403 with meaningful error message
logged instead of raising the error.

Closes-bug: #2061759
Change-Id: Idfa050f7c97941cbe1a4f40b98e0264bce548164

commit_message:
Cluster Overview: Change columns and drawer items

* Remove column 'keypair'
* Add column 'coe_version' as "Kubernetes Version"

commit_message:
Use new sort method _sort_releases to support wrapped release names

Earlier trilio module was using sorted method to sort supported openstack releases,
but this method was causing issue for zed and yoga release and was considering antelope only.
With this change we are going to use the new method from core module _sort_releases which correctly handles
the situation.

Change-Id: I340d3b646d2472e751d01e2bf786ada7b19cbd3d
(cherry picked from commit 5f56d452158ce8c66846c8d8141a25a0f120effa)

commit_message:
add bashate to pre-commit

bashate is a linter for common bash issues
This change adds bashate to provide basic linting
of the devstack plugin.

Change-Id: I356486192112d1a3ad0ead75a57a984a6e575309
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/whitebox-tempest-plugin refs/changes/34/916534/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - repo: https://github.com/openstack/bashate.git rev: 2.1.1 hooks: - id: bashate entry: bashate --error . --ignore=E006,E040,E020,E012 # Run bashate check for all bash scripts # Ignores the following rules: # E006: Line longer than 79 columns (as many scripts use jinja # templating, this is very difficult) # E040: Syntax error determined using `bash -n` (as many scripts # use jinja templating, this will often fail and the syntax # error will be discovered in execution anyway) # E020: Function declaration not in format ^function name {$ # E012: here doc didn't end before EOF

subject: db_auditor: add vacuum support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-04-24 05:33:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/01e44cc52b890646f45f7172943c30d3171b1f2f', 'message': 'db_auditor: add vacuum support

As an SQLite database rows are deleted the file can become more sparse and
fragmented. When this happens the DB needs to be vacuumed.
A good indicator of sparsness in the file is the freelist page count.
Which is the number of pages that have been freed up (but not used).
The higher this number, the more sparse the file is getting. We can
montior this number while the db_auditor visits DBs and when it gets high
enough we can trigger a vacuum.

This patch adds a new option `freelist_vacuum_count` to the db_auditors.
If set to 0 (default) no checking or vacuuming in enabled. When set to a
positive integer, once the `freelist page count` in a DB gets higher
then this number it'll trigger a vacuum of the database.

In testing on a large root container downstream, a 500+MB sparse DB had:

  $ sqlite3 <large_root_db>.db ".dbinfo"
  ..
  freelist page count: 569463

Once vacumed it only took up 13MB and a freelist page count of 0.
From python we can get this freelist page count by:

  cur = conn.execute("PRAGMA freelist_count")
  cur.fetchone()
  >> (569463,)

If/when we want this enabled by default we can think about a good
default value. Maybe 1000 free pages seems reasonable?

The patch also adds `vacuum.success` and `vacuum.failure` increment
metrics, so we can track how many DBs get vacuumed.
The advantages of having the auditor do the vacuum are:

 - busy containers can get defragged and hopefully run more efficiently.
 - vacuumed containers means less data over the network during rebases.
 - We can tune to only vacuum when we want (over some threshold).
 - The extra io happens in the eventual consistancy engine and by the
   auditor, which probably makes more sense.

Closes-Bug: #1691648
Change-Id: Ic731f0d93b3054149db16ffd080683100ad377fd

commit_message:
db_auditor: add vacuum support

As an SQLite database rows are deleted the file can become more sparse and
fragmented. When this happens the DB needs to be vacuumed.
A good indicator of sparsness in the file is the freelist page count.
Which is the number of pages that have been freed up (but not used).
The higher this number, the more sparse the file is getting. We can
montior this number while the db_auditor visits DBs and when it gets high
enough we can trigger a vacuum.

In testing on a large root container downstream, a 500+MB sparse DB had:

  $ sqlite3 <large_root_db>.db ".dbinfo"
  ..
  freelist page count: 569463

Once vacumed it only took up 13MB and a freelist page count of 0.
From python we can get this freelist page count by:

  cur = conn.execute("PRAGMA freelist_count")
  cur.fetchone()
  >> (569463,)

We can also use PRAGMA's to get the page_size and total page count,
using these we calculate the freepage size (in bytes) and ratio with
used pages (free page percentage). This allows up to add 2 new
db_replicator options:

  - vacuum_threshold_size: The size (in bytes) the freepages need to
        take up before a vacuum is performed.
  - vacuum_threshold_percent: The percent of freepages before a vacuum
        is performed.

The patch also adds a few more increment metrics, firstly `vacuum.success`
and `vacuum.failure` so we can track how many DBs get vacuumed.

But also some metrics that fire off for _every_ db, whether the
threshold settings are enabled for not, to help us track the
bloatiness of DBs in the cluster and help ops determine starting
thresholds:

    <server-type>.freelist.percent.<bucket>
    <server-type>.freelist.size.<bucket>MB

For example:

    container.freelist.percent.70-79
    account.freelist.size.50-54MB

This first is an incremented if the container DB's freelist page percent
is between 70% and 80%. The second is an account whose freelist page
size is between 50MB and 55MB.

These should give us a basic gauge of the bloatiness of the metadata
layer in swift.

The advantages of having the auditor do the vacuum are:

 - busy containers can get defragged and hopefully run more efficiently.
 - vacuumed containers means less data over the network during rebases.
 - We can tune to only vacuum when we want (over some threshold).
 - The extra io happens in the eventual consistancy engine and by the
   auditor, which probably makes more sense.

Closes-Bug: #1691648
Change-Id: Ic731f0d93b3054149db16ffd080683100ad377fd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/61/916861/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import re self.re_match = re.compile(r'^[a-zA-Z]*([0-9]*).db$') def get_freelist_count(self): number = self.re_match.match(self.file).group(1) return int(number) if number else 0 def vacuum(self): # odd numbers fail to vacuum (just for stats) if self.get_freelist_count() % 2 == 0: return True else: return False def do_test(config): self.logger = debug_logger() test_auditor = FakeDatabaseAuditor(config, logger=self.logger) files = os.listdir(self.testdir) for f in files: path = os.path.join(self.testdir, f) test_auditor.audit(path) self.assertEqual(test_auditor.failures, 2) self.assertEqual(test_auditor.passes, 3) self.assertEqual( {'passes': 3, 'failures': 2}, test_auditor.logger.statsd_client.get_increment_counts()) do_test({}) do_test({'freelist_vacuum_count': 0}) def test_database_auditor_freelist_vacuum_count(self): # numbers bigger then the vacuum_count get vacuumed. We're just using # the number in the filename, and set it to 1 below, so only # true{2,3}.db will attempt to be vacuumed. conf = {'freelist_vacuum_count': 1} self.assertEqual( {'passes': 3, 'failures': 2, 'vacuum.success': 1, # odd numbers fail vacuum in this test harness ie true3.db # just so we can test metrics. 'vacuum.failure': 1}, test_auditor.logger.statsd_client.get_increment_counts())

commit_message:
[tool] setup-election-config: fix indent

Using a custom yaml dumper class to ensure that
timeline elements are indented

Change-Id: I73c69c8d0432db949470ff1cb360fc2d11839e7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/73/920173/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class IndentDumper(yaml.Dumper): def increase_indent(self, flow=False, indentless=False): return super().increase_indent(flow, False) print(yaml.dump(configuration, Dumper=IndentDumper, default_flow_style=False, default_style='', explicit_start=True))

commit_message:
Revert "Use RE2 compatible regex for irrelevant-files"

This reverts commit c76727b97c04016ee0d65d8d11623adbd8d60c69.

Reason for revert: This may have disabled most gate jobs.

Change-Id: I35ec1838711bed758f205fb372bbfae564d04c44

subject: Enable RabbitMQ feature flags pre-upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-06-03 09:09:19.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/rabbitmq-feature-flags-d1a0f3fd4e17cbf4.yaml', 'playbooks/rabbitmq-install.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/11bcd452bc8b3c9ea27dcf0e2aebe278d0edd5dc', 'message': 'Enable RabbitMQ feature flags pre-upgrade

This task must be carried out before any RabbitMQ instances are
stopped, so must live in the playbook as opposed to the role.

This complements the post-upgrade enablement which happens within
the role itself, and covers the case where older versions of the
role have not already enabled the relevant flags.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server/+/920997
Change-Id: Idf33b6810e1afb3a89dad5e65a48e86ac0a58a67
(cherry picked from commit 6a21e2e2676f6637330bd22ee64ef8f58c5f73e0)
'}]
commit_message:
Enable RabbitMQ feature flags pre-upgrade

This task must be carried out before any RabbitMQ instances are
stopped, so must live in the playbook as opposed to the role.

This complements the post-upgrade enablement which happens within
the role itself, and covers the case where older versions of the
role have not already enabled the relevant flags.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server/+/920997
Change-Id: Idf33b6810e1afb3a89dad5e65a48e86ac0a58a67
(cherry picked from commit 6a21e2e2676f6637330bd22ee64ef8f58c5f73e0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/98/920998/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Stable feature flags must be enabled pre-upgrade # https://www.rabbitmq.com/docs/feature-flags#version-compatibility - name: Enable stable feature flags pre-upgrade hosts: "{{ rabbitmq_host_group | default('rabbitmq_all') }}[0]" gather_facts: false user: root tasks: - name: Running feature flags tasks from the role import_role: name: rabbitmq_server tasks_from: rabbitmq_feature_flags.yml when: rabbitmq_upgrade | default(false) | bool

subject: WIP: Add ovn-bgp-agent / FRR / neutron-bgpvpn / Horizon BGPVPN dashboard support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-16 18:19:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/fff944af6b74a762bcae796534235873de69420d', 'message': 'WIP: Add ovn-bgp-agent / FRR / neutron-bgpvpn / Horizon BGPVPN dashboard support

ovn-bgp-agent [1] is a new component that exposes VMs/containers through BGP on OVN environments.

This change extends kolla-ansible to deploy ovn-bgp-agent and FRR, as this is a requirement for ovn-bgp-agent.
The neutron-server is extended to be able to enable the networking-bgpvpn plugin.
The openvswitch deployment is modified to allow for br-ex without connected physical ports as the traffic is routed instead.
Furthermore, it also extends the horizon integration to enable the BGPVPN dashboard plugin, that is also required for certain scenarios with ovn-bgp-agent.

This change is part of a set of changes in several projects that are nessecary to fully implement ovn-bgp-agent.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/+/883060
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/891617

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/ovn-bgp-agent

Change-Id: I4fde95dccd036e371239e21596c05ecfd5342270

commit_message:
WIP: Add ovn-bgp-agent / FRR / neutron-bgpvpn / Horizon BGPVPN dashboard support

ovn-bgp-agent [1] is a new component that exposes VMs/containers through BGP on OVN environments.

This change extends kolla-ansible to deploy ovn-bgp-agent and FRR, as this is a requirement for
ovn-bgp-agent.
The neutron-server is extended to be able to enable the networking-bgpvpn plugin.
The openvswitch deployment is modified to allow for br-ex without connected physical ports as
the traffic is routed instead.
Furthermore, it also extends the horizon integration to enable the BGPVPN dashboard plugin,
that is also required for certain scenarios with ovn-bgp-agent.

This change is part of a set of changes in several projects that are nessecary to fully
implement ovn-bgp-agent.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/891617

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/ovn-bgp-agent

Change-Id: I4fde95dccd036e371239e21596c05ecfd5342270

commit_message:
Add variable to configure storage options

With addition of storage v2 versions and v2 API it's now less trivial
to rely on overrides for storage configuration, which most likely will be
needed regardless, since v1 storages are incompatible with /v2 API,
and latter one gets disabled whenever v1 storage is in use.

With that there's no dummy storage in /v2 for testing purposes, so
we are not able to have any reasonable default out of the box.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/920058
Change-Id: Ic0d055c98ee6e35fb28b26de8cf3d20e7e79ad87
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cloudkitty refs/changes/92/912292/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Please define a storage for CloudKitty data in as a nested disctionary. # Keys `backend` and `version` are required. `config` contains extra # configuration for the storage backend when applicable. # For example: # cloudkity_storage: # backend: opensearch # version: 2 # config: # host = http://localhost:9200 # index_name = cloudkitty cloudkity_storage: backend: sqlalchemy version: 1

Debian 12 is now available in CI and has been used to run Python 3.11
tests.

This introduces a simple integration job with Debian 12, as a sanity
check, using that OS image.

This also moves puppet 8 tests from CentOS Stream 9 to Debian 12,
because Debian 12 uses Ruby 3.1 as its default ruby.

commit_message:
Add Debian integration job

Debian 12 is now available in CI and has been used to run Python 3.11
tests. This introduces a simple integration job with Debian 12, as
a sanity check, using that OS image.

Note that the horizon tempest test is intentionally disabled in Deiban
now because of the permission error we have not yet addressed.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/900839
Change-Id: If3f90faccc4f23ac48f14a842fadcd8cdcd27b25

commit_message:
Add query_metric extra_arg to prometheus collector

It allows overriding the metric_name on the PromQL query.
It also offer a way to join metrics (for example
`libvirt_domain_vcpu_maximum` which contains the amount of CPU for a
domain and `libvirt_domain_openstack_info` which contains the same
domain and the project_id).

Change-Id: I4f0892a80f37ce052f573e7622534aa728e7cff1

commit_message:
Fix check for internal endpoint enablement

For cinder volume backend sections, ensure that enabling internal
endpoint usage for service access does not completely clear the
existing content of the section.

Change-Id: I383a0794e924db3c7f4ce47d1e3b88355c2475e4
Closes-Bug: 2052726
(cherry picked from commit cfb228fc43ef29764295cefb45407162143cee09)

commit_message:
Enable feature flags post-upgrade

Stable feature flags must be enabled before upgrades to ensure
the service can still start. These additional tasks check for
any disabled feature flags and enable them. This is done
immediately after upgrades so that systems can run with them
enabled striaght away.

Closes-Bug: #2038818
Change-Id: I5211a30899f544a9f7e609e85551a92b245d25bf
(cherry picked from commit 5abd7b71ba87c3fdc5d1e1c790347e8da0a229cb)

commit_message:
Lazy import is not needed

There was an abandoned change that made reference to a RecussionError
when running a probe test that imported boto3 that had something to do
with eventlet, ssl and a transitive dependency on requests-mock, but the
fix that actually got merged seemed to depend on another change to
tox.ini that disables request-mock when we run pytest.

Either way, we already import from boto3 at the top of probe tests and
it's in test-requirements; so we require it to be installed even if you
don't have s3api in your pipeline.

Related-Change: I789b257635c031ac0cb6e4b5980f741e0cb5244d
Related-Change: I2793e335a08ad373c49cbbe6759d4e97cc420867
Related-Change: If14e4d2c1af2efcbc99e9b6fe10973a7eb94d589

Change-Id: Id2662bfc5ef2f21f901f1c98e6389c4cb01818a2

commit_message:
CI: Move off CentOS 8

Remove swift-tox-py36-centos-8-stream job entirely.

Move the following jobs to CentOS 9:

  - swift-tox-func-s3api-ceph-s3tests-tempauth
  - swift-tox-func-s3api-tests-tempauth
  - swift-multinode-rolling-upgrade, as well as the other rolling
    upgrade jobs

Remove the swift-multinode-rolling-upgrade-victoria job, as py39
support (required for CentOS 9) was not added until wallaby.

Change-Id: I4f6b9c07af7bc768654f1a5d0c66b048e0f2c9c1

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/02/920702/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: The main service configuration (/etc/$project/$project.conf) can still be used for configuration but the preferred way is to add config file snippets into /etc/$project/$project.conf.d/ instead. As part of the packaging, the package itself installs a config snippet at /etc/$project/$project.conf.d/010-$project.conf with basic configuration. This file should not be modified. In case there is a need to overwrite or add settings, a XXX-$project.conf (XXX being a 3 digit number) should be created instead. Config directory file snippet naming should follow these conventions: - snippets should start with "XXX-" where "X" is a number - snippets must end with ".conf" - config management systems (Crowbar, Salt, ...) should use numbers between 100 and 499 - users should use numbers starting from 500 Configuring just a single $program (eg for Nova, $project is "nova" and $program is "nova-api", "nova-compute", "nova-scheduler", ...) can be done in a similar way. The config snippets should be placed in /etc/$project/$program.conf.d/ . The same snippets rules apply here, too. $program reads the configuration files in the following order: - /etc/$project/$project.conf - /etc/$project/$project.conf.d/*.conf (lexically sorted) - /etc/$project/$program.conf.d/*.conf (lexically sorted) The last configured key overwrites all previous ones. In particular, settings in /etc/$project/$project.conf are overwritten by config values from any file in /etc/$project/$project.conf.d/XXX-$project.conf .

commit_message:
Allow openstack_hosts role to configure git safe.directory entries

This is defaulted to '*" and will be undefined when a CI specific
override is subsequently merged to the openstack-ansible repository.

Change-Id: I1c1dc35d8d59db4ae2b6770a620d91548a8a3734
(cherry picked from commit a8d1c8268a252cd7cc5ff0ec0988b75277a0a5fe)

commit_message:
Stable changes for stable/2024.1 (caracal) branch

This patch converts stable/2024.1 into a stable maintenance branch. It:

- modifies .gitreview to point to stable/2024.1
- switches (test-)requirements*.txt -> (test-)requirements*.in
  for pip-compile usage.
- creates (test-)requirements-py*.txt from *.in using pip-compile for
  the relevant python version.
- Updates bundles to point to ceph/edge and 24.04/edge for ceph and
  OVN charms.
- Adds build.lock file to the reactive charms.
- Syncs charm-helpers for classic charms.
- Locks requirements.txt from requirements.in for ops machine charms.
- Locks charms.openstack, zaza, zaza-openstack-tests, charm-helpers to
  stable branches.

Change-Id: Ic060c27fc7f74a058391f10ab3b279344cc00785

subject: Fix container image build issues with letsencrypt
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-06-04 11:42:25.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/inventory/group_vars/all/kolla', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-kolla-enable-letsencrypt-8e8746560be575ac.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/8e2a3aeb5e5c012e66194af1059043ab01752a05', 'message': 'Fix container image build issues with letsencrypt

The kolla_enable_letsencrypt variable was undefined, which was causing
overcloud container image build to fail when the variable was not
defined in Kayobe configuration.

The bool filter was missing for kolla_enable_letsencrypt, which was
causing letsencrypt images to be built when kolla_enable_letsencrypt was
set to "false" or "no".

Change-Id: I234b7a0434ba3d533a66b766331fd489078fbcf8
(cherry picked from commit 9669462208e1785c2d64485d6bdc10cc75210d39)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix container image build issues with letsencrypt

The kolla_enable_letsencrypt variable was undefined, which was causing
overcloud container image build to fail when the variable was not
defined in Kayobe configuration.

The bool filter was missing for kolla_enable_letsencrypt, which was
causing letsencrypt images to be built when kolla_enable_letsencrypt was
set to "false" or "no".

Change-Id: I234b7a0434ba3d533a66b766331fd489078fbcf8
(cherry picked from commit 9669462208e1785c2d64485d6bdc10cc75210d39)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/78/921278/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes bugs with the ``kolla_enable_letsencrypt`` variable which were causing overcloud container image build to fail, or to include ``letsencrypt`` images when disabled.

commit_message:
Configure all directories to be safe for git clone in CI

CI jobs use the file:// mechanism to clone their repos and this is
now subject to 'safe' directory rules in lastest git.

See https://github.com/git/git/commit/f4aa8c8bb11dae6e769cd930565173808cbb69c8

Change-Id: I20efb9be544db6d4d66c9b8d968aaf44d96d899f
(cherry picked from commit 97ba42b524f7be1aae937df1646bc3f1ed9fbdad)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/02/921002/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix negative lookahead assertion syntax error

Python regexes are deprecated in Zuul, so this commit updates the
configuration to use RE2-compatible syntax.

Change-Id: If4973be103076f5a3879dc630e104d129377f7da

commit_message:
[WIP] Update the redfish interoperability profile

* Remove @Redfish.Copyright, it's not an allowed field.
* Remove unused fields such as AssetTag.
* Mark fields used in inspection and other optional features as
  optional.
* Add missing VirtualMedia on System and VirtualMedia fields.
* Add missing Thermal information and its subresources.
* Clarify which fields on System are links.
* Add Purpose field to all fields and actions.

Change-Id: I35f8f49e4c70e736b685c3eeebf79326592b6314

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import json import os from sphinx.application import Sphinx __version__ = "1.0.0" LEVELS = {0: '=', 1: '-', 2: '~', 3: '^'} class Writer: def __init__(self, dest): self.dest = dest def title(self, text, level): print(text, file=self.dest) print(LEVELS[level] * len(text), file=self.dest) def para(self, text): print(text, file=self.dest) print(file=self.dest) def resource(self, name, res, level): self.title(f"{name}", level) self.para(res.get('Purpose', '')) for name, prop in filter_properties(res, required=True).items(): self.resource(f"{name} (required)", prop, level + 1) for name, prop in filter_properties(res, required=False).items(): self.resource(name, prop, level + 1) def is_required(res): return ( res.get('WriteRequirement') == 'Mandatory' or res.get('ReadRequirement') in ('Mandatory', None) or any(is_required(item) for item in res.get('PropertyRequirements', {}).values()) ) def filter_properties(res, required): return {name: prop for name, prop in res.get('PropertyRequirements', {}).items() if required == is_required(prop)} def builder_inited(app: Sphinx): source = os.path.join(app.srcdir, app.config.redfish_interop_source) with open(source) as fp: profile = json.load(fp) fname = os.path.basename(source).replace('json', 'rst') dstdir = os.path.join(app.srcdir, app.config.redfish_interop_output_dir) with open(os.path.join(dstdir, fname), 'wt') as dest: w = Writer(dest) w.title(f"{profile['ProfileName']} {profile['ProfileVersion']}", 0) w.para(profile['Purpose']) w.resource('ComputerSystem', profile['Resources']['ComputerSystem'], 1) def setup(app: Sphinx): app.connect('builder-inited', builder_inited) app.add_config_value('redfish_interop_source', None, 'env', [str]) app.add_config_value('redfish_interop_output_dir', None, 'env', [str]) return {'version': __version__}

commit_message:
Add TLS proxy for novncproxy

This improvement enables TLS encryption for the novncproxy service, even
when enable_haproxy is False. This change is beneficial for operators
who run deployments using an external Load Balancer with enable_haproxy
set to False, but still require TLS encryption for the novncproxy
service.

Signed-off-by: Robert Breker
Signed-off-by: Oliver Schmitz

Change-Id: Ibb33aaf200f460c83ddeb9d0656ccaa6a655f142

commit_message:
GRUB conf template compatibility with arm server

Determine the appropriate GRUB commands during UEFI boot
based on the node's CPU architecture.

Closes-Bug: #2050054
Change-Id: I0c5f513cdc8f4112f8dfdeb4ccaf566d3424a2ca

added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python3 # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import json import os import tempfile import zipfile import jsonschema import requests # NOTE(dtantsur): keep in sync with the actually used version BUNDLE = "2024.1" SCHEMA_VERSION = "1_8_0" PROFILE_VERSION = "1_1_0" ROOT = "https://www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents" URL = f"{ROOT}/DSP8013_{BUNDLE}.zip" FILE = f"RedfishInteroperabilityProfile.v{SCHEMA_VERSION}.json" PROFILE = \ f"redfish-interop-profiles/OpenStackIronicProfile.v{PROFILE_VERSION}.json" with tempfile.TemporaryFile() as bundle: with requests.get(URL, stream=True) as remote: for chunk in remote.iter_content(): bundle.write(chunk) bundle.flush() bundle.seek(0) with zipfile.ZipFile(bundle) as unzipped: with unzipped.open(FILE) as schema_file: schema = json.load(schema_file) with open(os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", PROFILE)) as profile: jsonschema.validate(json.load(profile), schema)
